data.mPassive: You're a Star: Gains additional XP per second
data.mGeneral: The Starfish is a common pet released in the Summer Update. It has a 50% chance to be obtained from the Common Summer Egg. It has 1,500 Hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Starfish has five arms coming off of its body. It has a feminine face in the center which resembles a smile. It is mostly a coral-pink color with a lighter-colored vertical stripe down each of its arms.

Trait
You're a Star: Gains an additional ~6 xp per second!
Does not grant additional exp to other pets.
Starfish gains experience even when its hunger is 0.
It outranks Brown and Grey Mouse as a sacrificial pet for leveling up fast and getting extra pet slots / egg slots / pet inventory space.

It is currently the best pet to age up and exchange for the extra slots.

Depends on graphic quality settings, its face can changed from a joyful style look to a neutral like look when zooming out the camera.
This is one of the fastest growing Pets in the game.

Starfish is one of the slowest pets in the entire game. This can be seen in game when the starfish is compared to other pets.

data.mPassive: Pinch Pocket: Occasionally goes to another player and pinches them and grants you a small amount of sheckles
data.mGeneral: The Crab is a Common pet released in the Summer Update. It can be obtained from the Common Summer Egg. It has 3,000 Hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Crab resembles a stereotypical cartoonish crab, having oversized claws and two eyes sticking out above its head. It's a vibrant red color and keeps this color all around. It also has three pairs of legs as well as a smile on the front of its face.

Trait
Pinch Pocket: Occasionally goes to another player and pinches them, granting sheckles. Pinched players do not lose their sheckles. Crab does not seem to have a run time limit.
The Crab will still pinch the player from below if the player is high up. (on a plant, cosmetic, etc.)
The Crab cannot fall down of the map.

The Crab is one of the few pets that can interact directly with players. The other pets are the Raccoon, the Fennec Fox, the Kitsune and the Red Fox.

The Crab is the only pet that interacts with other players, and not with its owner.

data.mPassive: When the player get a Lucky Harvest: There is a 4 percent chance to get a extra seed!
data.mGeneral: The Seagull is a Common pet released in the Summer Update. It can be obtained from the Common Summer Egg for   1,000,000 or  29. It has 3,500 Hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Seagull resembles that of a real bird having a pair of wings and feet as well as a long beak. It is mostly white with tuft of feathers on its head as well as a beak which fades from burnt orange to amber in color. It has two small feet that are a candy-pink. It also has two large black eyes on the front of its face.

Trait
When the player get a Lucky Harvest: There is a 4 percent chance to get a extra seed!

(Formerly) Scavenger: Shoveling plants have a percent chance to drop the equivalent seed. Does not work on fruits.
The Seagull flies slightly crooked.

The Seagull was the first pet to modify the Shovel.

The Seagull ability is lost like the Squirrel, due to an exploit people abused.

data.mPassive: Every 40s, eats a carrot at a 1.5x value bonus.
data.mGeneral: The Bunny is a Common Pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Common Egg with a chance of 33.33%. The Bunny has 1,100 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Bunny is a white bunny with pink inner-ears, black facial features, and white ears, head, body, limbs, and tail.

Trait
Every ~40 seconds, the Bunny searches for a Carrot, Chocolate Carrot or Wild Carrot on the garden and eats it, automatically selling it at a marked up price of 1.5x value. The sell value multiplier increases as the Bunny ages.

If no Carrots are planted in the garden or the only ones available have been favorited, Bunnies will wander around aimlessly.
The Bunny's passive is similar to the Black Bunny and the Bagel Bunny.

It is also similar to the Panda. Instead of eating Carrots, the Panda eats Bamboo.

This pet doesn’t give money upon eating a carrot similar to the Panda.

data.mPassive: Every 60s, 5% chance to dig up a random seed.
data.mGeneral: The Dog is one of the 23 pets added in the Grow a Garden Update 1.04.0. It can be obtained by hatching a Common Egg with a 33.33% chance. The Dog has 1,000 hunger. Its ability is identical to the Golden Lab but with a ~5% chance instead of a ~10% chance like the Golden Lab.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Dog is a predominantly white dog with brown ears and a brown spot over its left eye with black facial features. It shares the same model as the Golden Lab.

Trait
Every ~60 seconds, the Dog will attempt to dig up a random seed (only Seed Shop plants), with a ~5% chance to succeed.
The Dog and the Frog are the only pets that have another variant from the same egg with an increased ability chance/cooldown.

The probability of a Dog actually triggering its trait is half that of the Golden Lab, even though they perform the same function.

The Dog, Golden Lab, and Shiba Inu all have similar abilities, which is digging.

data.mPassive: Digging friend: ~10% chance to dig up a random Seed Shop seed every 60 seconds.
data.mGeneral: The Golden Lab is a common pet added in Update 1.04.0. It can be obtained by hatching the Common Egg with a chance of 33.33%. The Golden Lab has 1,200 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Golden Lab is a recolor of the Dog, having brown ears and a beige body, and lacks spots on its body & face. It also has a stud-like texture on its entire body.

Trait
Every 60 seconds, the Golden Lab will attempt to dig up, with a 10% chance to succeed, a random seed that can be found in the Seed Shop, regardless of if it's on stock or not. Higher rarity seeds have a lower chance of being dug up.
The Golden Lab is based off the Labrador Retriever in real life.

The Golden Lab's trait has a 2x higher chance of succeeding than the Dog's, even though they are from the same egg with the same chances.

data.mPassive: Every ~25m, flies to a nearby fruit and pollinates it, applying the Pollinated mutation.
data.mGeneral: The Bee is an Uncommon Pet introduced in the Bizzy Bee Event update. There is a 65% chance of hatching it from the Bee Egg, which could be previously purchased for  30,000,000 Sheckles or 129 Roblux, until it was added in the Honey Merchant for 18 Honey. The Bee has 25,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Bee's model resembles the Honey Bee and Disco Bee, but features a mostly yellow body with black stripes, black antennae, and light gray wings.

Trait
Every ~25 minutes, the Bee flies to a nearby fruit and pollinates it, applying the Pollinated Mutation. When pollination occurs, the following message appears: Bee applied Pollinated mutation to [Fruit].
Favorite Foods
The following foods fill Bee's hunger by large increase. The Bee prefers flowers type foods. Mutated food versions increase the amount of hunger points.

Rose (Around 10%)
Pink Lily (Around 60%)
Lilac (Around 80%)

The Bee is one of the pets with the highest cooldown in the game.

data.mPassive: Every 40 seconds, the Black Bunny searches for a Carrot on the garden and eats it, automatically selling it at a marked up price of 1.5x value.
data.mGeneral: The Black Bunny is an Uncommon pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained from hatching the Uncommon Egg with a chance of 25%, and is a variant of the Bunny. The Black Bunny has 1,300 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Black Bunny is a recolor of the Bunny, having a black body, pink inner ears, and a pink nose.

Trait
Every ~40 seconds, the Black Bunny searches for a Carrot, Chocolate Carrot or Wild Carrot on the garden and eats it, automatically selling it at a marked up price of ~1.5x value.

The Black Bunny's passive is similar to the Bunny and the Bagel Bunny.
It is also similar to the Panda. Instead of eating Carrots, the Panda eats Bamboo.

Although Black Bunny is ranked as uncommon, its passive is worse than the Bagel Bunnys, which is ranked as Common.

data.mPassive: Every 80 seconds, the Cat will nap for 10 seconds. New fruit within 10 studs will be 1.25x larger.
data.mGeneral: The Cat is an Uncommon pet added in the Animal Update. It has a 25% chance of hatching from an Uncommon Egg.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Cat has a gray body, with dark gray whiskers and markings. The inner ears and nose are both pink, and the eyes and mouth are both black. It shares the same model with the Orange Tabby and the Moon Cat.

Trait
Every 80 seconds, the Cat naps for 10 seconds. Nearby plants within 10 studs will have their new fruit grow 1.25x larger.

data.mPassive: Increases egg hatch speed by 10%.
data.mGeneral: The Chicken is an Uncommon pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained from hatching the Uncommon Egg with a chance of 25%. Its maximum hunger is 3,400.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Chicken has a yellow body, orange feet and beak, and a red comb.

Trait
The Chicken passively increases egg hatch speed by approximately 10%. This boost can stack with other pets as well as the Rooster, Kiwi and the Blood Kiwi.

data.mPassive: Gives a 3% chance for berry plants to stay when harvested.
data.mGeneral: The Deer is an Uncommon Pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Uncommon Egg with a chance of 25%. The Deer has 2,500 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Deer is a brown deer with beige antlers and black eyes. It has dark hooves, a beige patch below its mouth, and a beige underside. It shares its model with the Spotted Deer.

Trait
The Deer has a passive trait which gives a 3% chance for berry plants to replant themselves when harvested.

data.mPassive: Every 100 seconds, thumps its feet and has a ~15% chance to mutate a nearby fruit, applying the Sandy mutation!
data.mGeneral: The Jackalope is an obtainable, limited time pet, that was released on the Beanstalk Event Update.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The appearance of the Jackalope is similar to the mythical animal which goes by the same name, it features a full light brownish body with a pink nose and dark brown antelope horns.

Trait
Every 100 seconds, thumps its feet and has a 15% chance to mutate a nearby fruit, applying the Sandy mutation.

data.mPassive: Fortune Cat: Every 2 minutes, waves and invites good fortune that grants 8% chance to refund fruit back to player’s inventory for 10s! Rarer fruit have rarer chance to refund.
data.mGeneral:
The Maneki-neko is an uncommon pet, obtained from the Kitsune Chest (during the Zen Event) or from the Exotic Kitsune Chest.
The Maneki-neko is a pure white cat with a red collar and gold bell. Its left paw is raised in a beckoning manner and has a Gold (Koban) coin on its forehead.
data.mTrivia: Every 2 minutes, waves and invites good fortune that grants 8% chance to refund fruit back to player’s inventory for 10s! Rarer fruit have rarer chance to refund.

data.mPassive: ~2.5% to refund fruit back to your inventory. Rarer plants have a lower chance to refund.
data.mGeneral: The Monkey is a rare pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Rare Egg with a chance of 8.33%.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Monkey closely resembles that of a real monkey, having two large ears, two arms and legs, and a long, curly tail. It is mostly a dark, chocolaty brown with a bright and paler brown color for its inner ears, face, underbelly, hands, and feet. It has rectangular black eyes and a dark brown smile.

Trait
The Monkey has a passive trait that gives a ~2.5% chance of refunding a plant back to the player when selling. Rarer plants have a lower refund chance.

data.mPassive: Every 90 seconds, naps for 15 seconds and causes new fruit within 15 studs to grow 1.5x larger.
data.mGeneral: The Orange Tabby is a Rare pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained from hatching the Rare Egg with a chance of 33.33%. The Orange Tabby has 1,500 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Orange Tabby is a recolor of the Cat, having an orange body and pink inner ears & nose.

Trait
Every 90 seconds, the Orange Tabby takes a 15 second nap. After the nap, any new fruit within 15 studs will grow 1.5x larger.

This pet shares a similar ability with Moon Cat and Cat.

data.mPassive: Every 118 seconds, the pig emits a 15 second aura that grants a 2x chance for plants within 15 studs to grow variant fruits.
data.mGeneral: The Pig is a Rare pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Rare Egg with a chance of 16.67%.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Pig has a pink body, ears, and snout, and brown hooves. The Pig's face is on one end of the body rather than a head.

Trait
Every 118 seconds, emits an aura for 15 seconds granting 2x chance for new fruit to grow as variants within 15 studs! (Rainbow and Gold)

data.mPassive: Increases egg hatch speed by ~20%.
data.mGeneral: The Rooster is a rare pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Rare Egg with a chance of 16.67%.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Rooster has a blue base with an orange head along with orange feet, a red beak, and a red comb. It shares most of its model with the Chicken.

Trait
The Rooster has a passive trait that increases egg hatch speed by ~20%.
If the user holds 8 roosters, eggs hatch in 16.77% of the time they would normally need (example: Bug Egg: Base time = 8 hours -> 1.34 hours, which is roughly 1 hour 20 minutes.

data.mPassive: Gives a 5% chance for berry plants to stay when harvested.
data.mGeneral: The Spotted Deer is a Rare pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Rare Egg with a chance of 25%. The Spotted Deer has 2,500 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Spotted Deer is a recolor of the Deer, with white spots on its snout and forehead.

Trait
Gives a 5% chance for berry plants to stay when harvested.

data.mPassive: Fat Snake: Increased lucky harvest chance!
data.mGeneral: Tsuchinoko is a Rare pet, obtained in the Corrupted Zen Egg.
data.mTrivia: The Tsuchinoko's appearance is characterized by its stocky, mallet-like body resembling of a snake, sharing it's similarities to the Tsuchinoko from Japanese Folklore.

data.mPassive: Flamboyance: Occasionally stands on one legs and all nearby plants will grow incredibly fast
data.mGeneral: The Flamingo is an obtainable, rare pet released in the Summer Update and is obtainable in the Rare Summer Egg with a 17% of being in the egg shop.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Flamingo resembles a stereotypical cartoonish flamingo. It has a long neck, legs, and beak. It is mostly a bubblegum pink, having its entire body the same color, as well as most of its beak and pair of wings. Its long, curved legs are more of a salmon pink color and its beak has a black tip on the end of it. Its face consists of two large eyes with a white sclera and black pupils.

Trait
Flamboyance: Every ~4 minutes, stands on one leg for ~15 seconds. All crops and produces within ~13 studs grow ~15x faster.

Moving plants using Trowel close to Flamingo works.

data.mPassive: Tropical Lover: Makes all nearby Tropical type plants have increased variant chance and grow bigger
data.mGeneral: The Toucan is a rare pet released in the Summer Update.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The appearance of the Toucan is similar to that of the Seagull's, being a bird. It is mostly black with an overall stubby appearance. It has small wings and feet, but a large beak. Its feet are cerulean, and its beak is a scarlet color on top that fades into a sunset orange. It also has two white circles around its light brown and black eyes.

Trait
Tropical Lover: Grants all tropical plants within ~25 studs, a ~1.2x size bonus and a ~1.18x variant chance bonus!

Moving plants closer to Toucan with Trowel does not work. The plant must be existing already.

The Toucan makes a chirping sound occasionally.

data.mPassive:
Every ~11minutes, shares its wisdom with a random pet, granting 1k bonus experience!
Every 150seconds, splashes water at a nearby fruit and it has some chance to get Wet mutation!
data.mGeneral: The Sea Turtle is an obtainable, rare pet released in the Summer Update
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Sea Turtle has a simple shape. It is flat with four flippers, a large head and a dome-shaped shell. Its body is a grassy green, and its shell is a dark, foresty green. It has one black eye on either side of its face and doesn't appear to have a mouth.

Trait
Shell Share: Every ~12 minutes, shares its wisdom with a random pet, granting ~1000 bonus experience!

Water Splash: Every ~118 seconds, water splashes at a nearby fruit and it has a 10% chance to become Wet!

The splashed water does not make the growing plants and growing fruits/crops grow bigger nor faster. It can only affect fully grown Fruits/Crops nearby.

Sea turtle can try to apply wet mutation to fruits with drenched or frozen mutation, the fruits however wont get it even if applied successfully

If players want to make crops become Frozen from Sea Turtle and Polar Bear/Sushi Bear, it's recommended to put down Sea Turtle first, then Polar Bear/Sushi Bear after player's crop got the Wet mutation. It prevent player's fruits from being splash by Sea Turtle after gotten Frozen on a fruit

data.mPassive: Helping Hands: When crafting, each material has a chance for it not to be consumed
data.mGeneral: The Orangutan is a rare pet released in the Summer Update.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Orangutan has a more complex build than many pets. It has a round face, two large muscular arms, and two legs behind it. It also has noticeable hands and feet with them being smaller in diameter than its arms and legs. Its back is a subtle orange color, and the rest of its "fur" is a burnt orange color. Its face, ears, and paws are an ashy gray. Its face has two black eyes, two large ears, and a snout with two nostrils and a smile, noticeably, the orangutan has flanges, meaning all Orangutans in grow a garden are exclusively male.

Trait
Helping Hands: When crafting, each material has a ~3.49% chance for it not to be consumed.

data.mPassive: Seal the Deal: When selling pets, has a (0.22 * Weight + 2.5)% chance to get the pet back as its egg equivalent!
data.mGeneral: The Seal is an obtainable, rare pet released in the Summer Update.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Seal has a fairly simple appearance. Its entire body is one color, being a slightly brownish gray. It has its head picked up by its neck, two flippers, on either side of it towards the front of its body, and a tail. On its face, it has a black eye on each side of its face and a snout that pops out the front that has a small brown nose.

Trait
Seal the Deal: When selling pets, has a (0.22 * Weight + 2.5)% chance to get the pet back as its egg equivalent ( cap at 8% ). Cannot refund rainbow/exotic/premium eggs.

Medium Toy boosts the passive by 0.5 %

Small Toy boosts the passive by 0.25 %
The Seal has percentage cap of 8% max, meaning the best possible egg return outcome with maxed seals and all unlocked pet slots is 64% .

The seal can't recover exotic/premium/rainbow eggs because of a bug people found.

Previously, Nihonzaru has a maximum buff of 1.32 % on this pet before it was nerfed,

data.mPassive: Every ~20 minutes flies to a nearby fruit and pollinates it, giving it a pollinated mutation
data.mGeneral:
The Honey Bee is a rare Pet introduced in the Bizzy Bee Event update.

The Honey Bee can be obtained in the Bee Egg, which can be bought for 18 Honey or 129 Roblux.

The Honey Bee has 25,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
Sharing the same model as a Bee, but with an overall honey glazed appearance. The Honey Bee features yellow-gold wings, a more orange-tinted look and falling honey particles.

Trait
Every ~20m, flies to a nearby fruit and pollinates it, applying the Pollinated mutation. This trait is exactly same with Bee, but with shorter cooldown.
The Honey Bee is sometimes confused with the Golden Bee, because of its similar appearance.

This pet is an upgrade of the Bee.

data.mPassive:
Every 30m, the Wasp flies to a nearby fruit and pollinates it, applying the Pollinated mutation.
Every 10m, the Wasp stings a random pet and advances its ability cooldown by 60s.
data.mGeneral: The Wasp is a rare pet introduced in the Friendship Update. The Wasp has 28,000 hunger. It can be obtained from the Anti Bee Egg with a 55% chance, which could be bought from the Limited Time Shop for 149 Roblux, or crafted with 1 Bee Egg and 25 Honey.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Wasp has a curved figure, with a darkened yellow body and a brighter yellow-black striped abdomen, sporting two pairs of dark yellow wings and an aggressive face.

Trait
Every 30 minutes, the Wasp flies to a nearby fruit and pollinates it, applying the Pollinated mutation. When pollination occurs, the following message appears: Wasp applied Pollinated mutation to the Plant.
Every 10 minutes, the Wasp stings a random pet and advances its ability cooldown by 60 seconds.

data.mPassive: Grants prickly fruit in a 30 studs radius a <1.50x size bonus!
data.mGeneral:
The Hedgehog has a stubby appearance. It has four small feet, two ears, and a chubby face. Its face has noticable cheeks and a snout with a nose that comes off the top. It has a neutral expression, having two black eyes and a neutral mouth. On its back, it has spikes resembling quills. Its body is a cream color, and its quills, nose, and inner ears are a softer brown.
Occasionally grants Cactus, Durian, Pineapple, Celestiberry, Nectar Thorn, Prickly Pear and Dragon Fruit a 1.51x size bonus. This trait is stackable, meaning that the more Hedgehogs a player has equipped on their farm, the bigger size will bonus they will get for their prickly fruits.
data.mTrivia:
Hedgehogs are primarily nocturnal, which make them more active at night.
The Hedgehog's trait is stackable.

data.mPassive: Every 60 seconds, decreases hatch time of egg with the highest remaining hatch time by 25 seconds.
data.mGeneral: The Kiwi is a bird with a brown body and head, that has a yellow beak and feet along with black eyes.
data.mTrivia:
he Kiwi's' passive is to go to the egg with the highest remaining hatch time and sing above it, making it decrease the egg's time by 25 seconds every minute.
However, the Kiwi will not do anything if there are no eggs on the player's plot or the eggs have no remaining time left, rendering it useless.

data.mPassive: Whisker Wisdom - Gains 500 bonus experience every 10 minutes. Increases the player's movement speed by 10% (Slightly increases as the player's pet(s) get(s) older).
data.mGeneral: The Grey Mouse is a Legendary pet added in the Blood Moon Event Update. It can be obtained with a 35.71% chance from hatching the Mythical Egg. It has 15,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Grey Mouse has gray fur, pink inner ears, and black facial features.

Trait
The Grey Mouse's passive trait allows it to gain ~500 bonus experience every ~10 minutes and increase the player's movement speed by ~10%.

Note: The ~500 bonus XP only applies to itself and does not affect other pets.

The Grey Mouse, Brown Mouse, Starfish, Mochi Mouse and Tanuki (when it rolls for experience) are the only pets that gain bonus experience.

data.mObtaining_method: Anti Bee Egg - Premium Anti Bee Egg
data.mPassive:
Wasp Pollinator - Every 25m, the Tarantula Hawk flies to a nearby fruit and pollinates it, applying the Pollinated mutation.
Tarantula Stinger - Every 5m, the Tarantula Hawk stings a random pet and advances its ability cooldown by ~ 80s.
data.mGeneral:
The Tarantula Hawk is a legendary Pet introduced in the Friendship Update.

The Tarantula Hawk has 28,000 hunger.

The Tarantula Hawk can be obtained from the Anti Bee Egg, which can be bought from the Limited Time Shop for  149 or crafted at the Cosmetics Shop for:
1 Bee egg
 25 Honey
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Tarantula Hawk resembles the Wasp, but has a different texture with a blue body and red-yellow wings. It's based off of its real-life counterpart, being the tarantula hawk.

Trait
Rarer than the Wasp, the Tarantula Hawk shares its traits but is better, with a 25-minute pollination cooldown (vs. 30), a 5-minute sting cooldown (vs. 10), and an ability cooldown reduced by 80 seconds (vs. 60).

The ability "Tarantula Stinger" can reduce the cooldown of pet mutation abilities, if the pet already doesn't have an active ability.

When the Tarantula Hawk first released, the ability "Tarantula Stinger" used to target pets without an active ability. This was later patched.

data.mPassive:
Clever Claws: 2% - 2.5% chance fruit gets Amber mutation after collecting! Rarer plants have a lesser chance to mutate.
Raptor Dance: Grants additional 14% - 14.5% increase to player movement speed!
data.mGeneral:
The Raptor is a Legendary pet added in the Prehistoric Event and is obtainable from the Dinosaur Egg with a 35% chance, or from the DNA Converter.
The Raptor seems to look like the Jurassic Park Raptors, but with green skin, and a long tail. (Not to be confused with the T-Rex's appearance)
data.mTrivia:
Clever Claws: 2% - 2.5% chance fruit gets Amber mutation after collecting! Rarer plants have a lesser chance to mutate. (+0.0475% mutation chance per level up.)
Raptor Dance: Grants additional 14% - 14.5% increase to player movement speed! (+0.0475% player movement speed per level up.)
The holding style of this pet is very unique, as instead of holding the pet in one hand, the player carries it in two hands and hold it above their head.

data.mPassive: Tri-Horn: Every 3:33m, rams into 3 random plants and advances their growth by 33:33m. Has a 15.18% chance to do it again each time.
data.mGeneral:
The Triceratops is a Legendary pet obtainable from the Dinosaur Egg with a 32.5% chance or through the DNA Converter during the Prehistoric Event. It is known for its powerful passive ability that speeds up plant growth, making it ideal for passive farming strategies.
The Triceratops has a red body with a rugged texture, complemented by three prominent grey horns on its face. It walks with a lumbering gait and has a spiked tail. Its design is a homage to the Triceratops from Dinosaur Simulator.
data.mTrivia:
Tri-Horn: Every 3 minutes and 33 seconds, the Triceratops charges into 3 random plants and advances each of their growth stages by 33 minutes and 33 seconds. Each time this activates, there is a 15.18% chance for the ability to trigger again, stacking multiple times.
This ability can significantly speed up the growth of slow-yield crops, especially when the player is offline or managing large gardens.
The Triceratops is one of only a few pets with a repeating-trigger passive ability.
Its ability references the number 3 repeatedly: 3 plants, 3:33 minute cooldown, and 33:33 growth advancement, referring to the Triceratop's 3 horns
It shares color themes with its appearance in the game Dinosaur Simulator.

data.mPassive:
Prehistoric Doubling: Small chance to duplicate harvested fruit
Prehistoric Harvester: Increased chance to duplicate harvested prehistoric type plant
data.mGeneral:
The Stegosaurus is a Legendary pet added in the Prehistoric Event and is obtainable from the Dinosaur Egg or from the DNA Converter.
The Stegosaurus is formed as a real-life Stegosaurus, featuring a green body with red scales protruding outward on top.
data.mTrivia:
Prehistoric Doubling: ~8% chance to duplicate harvested fruit (Rarer crops have a lower chance of being duplicated).
Prehistoric Harvester: ~5% extra chance to duplicate harvested prehistoric-type fruits.

data.mPassive:
Sky Reptile: Occasionally applies Windstruck mutation to multiple nearby fruits with a chance of Twisted!
Air Time: Grants additional 14,39% increase to player jump height!
data.mGeneral:
The Pterodactyl is a Legendary pet obtainable from the Dinosaur Egg or from the DNA Converter.
The Pterodactyl has a blue body, featuring a yellow sting and a light-blue beak. It has a pair of light blue legs.
data.mTrivia:
Sky Reptile: Occasionally applies Windstruck mutation to multiple nearby fruits with a chance of replacing with Twisted!
Air Time: Grants additional 14.39% increase to player's jump height.

data.mPassive: All sprinklers last ~20% longer.
data.mGeneral: The Silver Monkey is a Legendary Pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Legendary Egg with a chance of 42.55%. It has 8,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia: The Silver Monkey gives an 8% chance to refund crops back to a player's inventory. Rarer crops have a lower chance of receiving these refunds. For example, a Carrot has a higher chance of being refunded than a Beanstalk. This chance stacks with other Silver Monkeys, as well as Monkeys.

data.mPassive: Leaf lover passive : Leafy Plants grow 1.5x-2.5x faster.
data.mGeneral: The Caterpillar is a legendary Pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Bug Egg with a chance of 40%.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Caterpillar is a short, green insect with 6 dark green legs and 2 light green ones. Its body is made up of two large black eyes and several small segments with mainly light and dark green body parts.

Trait
The Caterpillar has a passive trait which makes all leafy plants grow 1.5x-2.5x faster. This only applies to plants directly from seeds.

data.mPassive: Extra 5.08% chance harvested plants drop seeds. Rarer plants have a lower chance to drop seeds
data.mGeneral: The Snail is a legendary pet added in the Animal Update. It has a 30% chance of being hatched from a Bug Egg. The Snail has 12,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance

data.mPassive: Verdant Bird: Every 8:00m, 16% chance to mutate a nearby fruit, applying the Verdant mutation.
data.mGeneral: The Scarlet Macaw is an obtainable Legendary pet from the Summer Update.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The appearance of the Scarlet Macaw closely resembles the Toucan in terms of proportions and build. It has a pair of wings, two feet, and a small beak. It has a vibrant red body that covers most of it. It has a bright yellow stripe on its wings, followed by a blue tip on the rest of its wings. It has pale yellow feet, white circles around its eyes and a black beak.

Its shape is identical to the Hyacinth Macaw pet, but the colors are much different.

Trait
Verdant Bird: Every ~8:00m, 16.00% chance to mutate a nearby fruit (chance can vary by age), applying the Verdant mutation.

When performing this, the Scarlet Macaw will have a rainbow aura with feathers surrounding it.

When there are no nearby fruits, the Scarlet Macaw skips its ability and the cooldown starts again.
The Scarlet Macaw has another variant, called Hyacinth Macaw, that instead of giving the Verdant Mutation, gives the Cloudtouched Mutation.

In the new updated Pet Menu, the Scarlet Macaw appears to have two cooldowns. One is ~8 seconds and appears to do nothing, and the second one is its normal ability.

data.mPassive: Eggsperience: Grants pets hatched from eggs an age bonus
data.mGeneral: The Ostrich is an obtainable legendary pet released in the Summer Update.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The appearance of the Ostrich is unique to most other pets. It has a long neck and slightly long legs. It also has two wings and a puffy tail in the back. Its body is black as well as most of its wings and tail, but its wings and tail are tipped white. Its face, neck, and feet are of a neutral beige color. Its face has two black eyes, a large, pale orange beak, and pink cheeks.

Trait
Eggsperience: Grants pets hatched from eggs an age bonus.

This trait can be stacked with other active ostriches.

There was a bug where Ostrich does not increase pet weight according to their level. This is a massive nerf because usually, when pets levels up, their weight increases too.

Pet Stats (Ability Cooldown, Ability Chance, etc) actually depends on pet weight, not level (although there are Pet Stats which stays the same no matter the level and weight, such as Triceratops).

This bug was patched after a while.

The Ostrich's maximum age bonus per hatch is capped at 10, beyond this point, weight nor age affects the ability further. This makes it ill advised to continue leveling the Ostrich or hatching a Giant variant once the cap is reached.

Although the Ostrich's maximum age bonus is limited, stacking multiple ostriches together can increase the pet's age beyond 10, making it possible to instantly hatch a pet with up to level 80 (8 maxed age bonus ostriches at once.

Despite being the most common pet in the Paradise Egg, it can be considered to be immensely useful under certain conditions due to its unique ability.

data.mPassive: Utter Beauty: Occasionally fans its feathers and all nearby pets will advance ability cooldowns
data.mGeneral: The Peacock is a legendary pet released in the Summer Update. It can be obtained with a 30% chance by hatching a Paradise Egg.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Peacock is a very colorful pet like its real-life counterpart. It is built very uniquely with a long neck, a crest on its head, a long beak, two wings, two legs, and a feathery tail. Its body and most of its crest are a royal blue, and its wings, tail, and crest tips are a vibrant green. Its beak is a sandy tan color as well as some specks on the top and bottom of each feather on its tail. Its legs are a sunny yellow as well as the spots around its eyes. It has a feminine pupil shape with eyelashes on each eye.

Trait
Utter Beauty: Occasionally fans its feathers every ~10 minutes and all nearby pets will advance ability cooldowns by ~60 seconds.

Max buff can gain from a Nihonzaru are:

Cooldown : -36 seconds.
Range : +1.2 studs.
Time Advanced : +3.6 seconds.
Medium Toy buff are:

Cooldown: -121 seconds.
Range: +4 studs.
Time Advanced : +13 seconds.
Small Toy is the same as Medium toy but equal 1/2 it.

As of v1747, Minimum cooldown is now 15 seconds.

data.mPassive: Chill Zone: All pets within 15.48 studs won`t lose hunger and will gain 3.48xp every second.
data.mGeneral: The Capybara is an obtainable legendary pet released in the Summer Update.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The appearance of the Capybara is quite simple. It has a large head and snout as well as a chubby body. It has little feet as well as small ears on the top of its head. It's a cocoa-colored brown with darker brown ears, front of its snout, and bottom of its feet. Each of its feet have three small toes on it. The front of its snout also has a smile.

Trait
Chill Zone: All pets within ~15.5 studs won't lose hunger and will gain ~3XP every second before aging. The boost increases as the Capybara ages.
Ability is always active. Once another pet gets close to the Capybara, they will immediately gain extra XP per second, and they will not lose hunger.

Unlike how Owls work, the Capybara's ability affects pets with no hunger remaining.

Capybara's ability will stack with other capybaras if they are in the same area of effect.

Before zen update part 2. Capybara's ability stop from time to time when either having multiple players. or when unequipping and equipping pets. As of now it has been fixed.

data.mGeneral:
The Sea Otter is a Legendary pet added in the Animal Update.

It can be obtained by hatching the Legendary Egg with a chance of 10.64%. It has 30,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Sea Otter has dark grey fur, white lower body, black facial features, and brown paws.

Trait

data.mPassive: 8% chance to refund crops.
data.mGeneral: The Silver Monkey is a Legendary Pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Legendary Egg with a chance of 42.55%. It has about 8,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Silver Monkey is a recolor of the Monkey with light and dark gray fur.

Trait
The Silver Monkey gives an 8% chance to refund crops back to a player's inventory. Rarer crops have a lower chance of receiving these refunds. For example, a Carrot has a higher chance of being refunded than a Candy Blossom.

This chance stacks with other Silver Monkeys, as well as Monkeys.
When in the Pet Mutator, the Silver Monkey will appear as a regular Monkey. This is most likely a bug.

If a Silver Monkey that is actively placed in the player's garden has the Inverted mutation, only the eyes invert color. The rest of the model stays the same. This is most likely a bug, as the pet icon for the Inverted Silver Monkey shows the entire pet model with inverted colors.

Same with the Golden mutation. The Silver Monkey will only have golden rays radiating from it instead of the golden color.

data.mGeneral: Every ~3 minutes, the Panda will eat bamboo off the players' plot and sell it for ~1.5x value boost.
data.mTrivia:
Every ~3 minutes, the Panda goes to a bamboo in the garden and eats it, immediately selling it for a ~1.5x value increase. The player still receives the money after the Panda eats the bamboo. If there's no bamboo in the garden, the Panda will walk around the garden aimlessly.
The Panda is currently the rarest pet.
The Panda gives 0 Coins when sold, similar to Cooked Owl and Bald Eagle.
It cannot recognize mutations, so it will sell bamboo with mutations for the same price as a normal bamboo.
The Panda was the first pet that couldn't be obtained from an egg.

data.mGeneral:
The Blood Hedgehog is a Legendary pet added in the Blood Moon Event update.
The Blood Hedgehog has 30,000 hunger.

Appearance
The Blood Hedgehog shares the same model as the Hedgehog, however is now a deep red, and has neon red pupils.
data.mTrivia:
The Blood Hedgehog's trait is Sanguine Spike, which grants a ~2x size within ~25 studs and ~1.17x variant bonus with in ~20 studs of a prickly fruit. The ability can stack with other hedgehog abilities:

New fruit weight = Base weight * (1 + 1 for each Blood Hedgehog + 0.5 for each normal Hedgehog)
The Blood Hedgehog always applied its abilities only in a specific range of a plant, but this was only recently specified in the ability description, (as confirmed by a developer) causing some to believe it was nerfed.

data.mPassive: Gains 750 bonus experience every 8 minutes. Increases the player's jump height by 12%.
data.mGeneral: The Brown Mouse is a Mythical Pet added in the Blood Moon Event Update. It can be obtained with a 26.79% chance from hatching the Mythical Egg. It has 15,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Brown Mouse is a recolor of the Grey Mouse with brown fur.

Trait
The Brown Mouse's passive trait allows it to gain ~750 bonus experience every ~8 minutes and increases the player's jump height by ~12%.

Note: The ~750 bonus XP only applies to itself and does not affect other pets.

The Brown Mouse, Grey Mouse, Starfish, Mochi Mouse, and Tanuki (when it rolls for experience) are the only pets that grant bonus experience for themselves.

The Brown Mouse’s ability stops when they reach zero hunger.

The Brown Mouse used to be the fastest aging pet with its passive trait, but the Starfish has taken its role as the best pet to use for pet/egg/pet-storage upgrades.

data.mPassive: ~10% chance for harvested crops to duplicate. Rarer fruits duplicate less often. ~5% extra chance for Candy type fruit to duplicate!
data.mGeneral: The Giant Ant is a Mythical Pet added in the Animal Update. The Giant Ant can be obtained by hatching the Bug Egg with a chance of 25% to hatch. The Giant Ant has 18,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Giant Ant has a blue body and head, as well as 6 dark blue legs and an antennae. It has two body segments: a torso and an abdomen.

Traits
The Giant Ant's first passive trait gives a ~10% chance to duplicate a fruit being harvested (If the crop is mutated, then all the mutations will also be copied and transferred to the crop duplicated by the Giant Ant). The rarer a fruit is, the less likely the fruit is to duplicate.

The Giant Ant's second passive trait gives an extra ~5% chance for candy type plants to be duplicated when harvested.

Upon testing, The Giant Ant gains more hunger points when fed Lilac or Candy Blossom,as opposed to other fruit. -(A base Candy Blossom will usually give about 90-100% hunger.)

data.mPassive: The Praying Mantis is a Mythical Pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Bug Egg with a 4% chance and has a hunger bar of 55,000.
data.mGeneral: The Praying Mantis is a Mythical Pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Bug Egg with a 4% chance and have 55,000 hunger bar.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
It has 4 small green legs and 2 big green claws. On its head, there are 2 black square eyes, big dark green mouth, and 2 antennas with light neon dots on it.

Trait
Every ~80 seconds, prays for ~10 seconds, granting ~1.5x variant chance within ~10 studs! (Rainbow, Gold and Silver)
The Praying Mantis increases variant chance of a growing fruit/crop in an already existing plant. This means using Trowel to move plants will not work.

Increased Variant Chance means increased chance of getting Growth Mutations (Gold or Rainbow).

The Praying Mantis does not magically give growth mutations to fully grown fruits/crops unlike Butterfly and Dragonfly.

data.mPassive: Seed Stash: Small chance to not consume a use when using the Reclaimer. Gains additional XP per second.
data.mGeneral: The Squirrel is a Mythical Pet added in the Blood Moon Event Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Mythical Egg, with a chance of 26.79%. It has 15,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Squirrel has brown fur, a beige underside, short ears, black eyes, and a black nose, closely resembling a real-life squirrel.

Trait
The Squirrel's trait grants a small chance for a use to not be consumed when using the Reclaimer tool. Also gains additional XP per second.

This section is a trivia section. Please relocate any relevant information into other sections of the article.

In versions 1385 and earlier, squirrels gave players a 2.5% chance to keep a seed after planting. People exploited this to duplicate exclusive seeds. This is an intentional feature and still works, just not for exclusive seeds anymore.

The Squirrel lost its ability to duplicate seeds and was given the replacement ability which now save Reclaimed uses- presumably due to seed duplication exploiting.
The Squirrel is one of the 5 pets that can gain additional XP. (The 5 pets are, Starfish, Grey Mouse, Brown Mouse, Mochi Mouse, and Squirrel)

Rainbow Flutter:
Every ~30m, flies to a nearby fruit with 5+ mutations, removes 5 mutations from it and turns it rainbow! Ignores favorited fruit.
data.mGeneral:
The Butterfly is a Mythical Pet introduced in the Friendship Update.

The Butterfly has 26,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Obtainment
The Butterfly can be obtained from the Anti Bee Egg, which can be crafted at the Cosmetics Shop in 2 hours for:

1 Bee Egg + 25 = 1 Anti Bee Egg
Bee Egg is still obtainable by the Honey Merchant. So players cannot get it until they have more honey or buy it with Robux.
Alternatively, the butterfly used to be obtainable by purchasing the Premium Anti Bee Egg for  149

Appearance
The Butterfly has a long, narrow purple body with a slightly rounded head and several small, evenly spaced black legs underneath. Its wings are large and angular, extending outward in a symmetrical "V" shape. Each wing is light purple and decorated with two vertical black rectangles near the center and four orange circular markings closer to the tips. The wings are flat and wide, with sharp corners and a stepped, block-like shape. The entire model has a clean, geometric design that emphasizes symmetry and stylized detail.

Trait
Every ~30m, flies to a nearby fruit with 5+ mutations, removes all Crop Mutations from it and turns it Rainbow! (Ignores favorited fruit).

Gold and Silver are Variants, not an Environmental Mutation so it won't work if it has only 4 Environmental Mutation and 1 Variant.
The Butterfly is one of the only three pets that can apply growth-variant mutations to plants. The second one being the Dragonfly and the third one being the Golden Bee.

Despite having an "only" 50x multiplier, Rainbow is the best mutation in the game. All Environmental Mutations are multiplied by Variants, meaning that the the 50x Rainbow value of the fruit acts as it's base value, and all other Mutations therefore become 50x more valuable as well.

data.mPassive: Boosts all the active pets XP by around 0.20 XP each second!
data.mGeneral:
The Owl is a limited mythical Pet added in the Lunar Glow Event 2025. It could have been obtained by completing the last milestone for the Wise Old Owl.
The Owl resembles its nightly counterpart, but with a white-blue color scheme and a glowing white aura.
data.mTrivia:
The Owl boosts all active pet XP by around 0.20 XP each second. When aging up, the increase goes up by 0.01 XP.
The Owl is one of four Owl types, the other three being the Night Owl, Cooked Owl, and Blood Owl.

data.mObtaining_method: Unknown (probably by being there when an update goes live)
data.mPassive: Pollinator: Occasionally pollinates fruit & Golden Harvest: Harvested fruit has a chance to turn to gold
data.mGeneral:
The Golden Bee is an unobtainable pet of Mythical tier.
The Golden Bee resembles the Bee, though it is entirely covered in gold. It also looks similar to the Honey Bee.
data.mTrivia: The Golden Bee has the ability to occasionally pollinate fruit and there is a small chance harvested fruit will turn gold.

data.mPassive: Every <5 minutes, croaks and causes a random nearby plant to advance growth by 24 hours.
data.mGeneral:
The Echo Frog is a Mythical pet added in the Lunar Glow Event. It can be obtained by hatching the Night Egg with a chance of 10%. It is an alternative & better version of the Frog. It has 50,000 hunger.
The Echo Frog is a recolor of the Frog. It features a blue body, dark blue facial features, and black eyes. Its ventral side is a lighter shade of blue and its adorned with neon blue spots around its body.
data.mTrivia: Every ~5 minutes, croaks and causes a random nearby plant to advance growth by 24 hours.

data.mObtaining_method: Join the game before the 1.10.0 update
data.mPassive:
Let Him Cook - Every 15 minutes, 15.35% chance to cook a nearby fruit. Usually Burnt, but occasionally Cooked!
Nocturnal Nursery - All active pets gain an additional 0.17 XP/s
data.mGeneral:
The Cooked Owl is a mythical pet that was obtainable in the game during the Crafting Update, It was also only obtainable during Jandel handouts during 16M players, if players look closely at the model, they will find a hint to a "Golden Bee" pet.
The Cooked Owl bears similarities to the Owl. It uses drumsticks in place of wings and its body is entirely brown to present itself as being cooked. There are also smoke particles coming out from the Cooked Owl's head.
data.mTrivia:
Every ~15 minutes, ~15.35% chance to cook a nearby fruit. Usually Burnt, but occasionally Cooked. All active pets gain an additional ~0.17 XP/s.
The Cooked Owl was teased during the release of the Cosmetics Update.
At the time of it being released, players online were given 2 Cooked Owls.
The Cooked Owl exists because of The Wise Old Owl not stocking good things causing Jandel to joke about turning the Wise Old Owl into a BBQ cosmetic.
The reason Cooked Owl Pet is ranked "Mythical" is because the Owl is ranked Mythical.
The Cooked Owl has 2 abilities: Let Him Cook, and Nocturnal Nursery.
The Cooked Owl gives 0 Coins when sold, similar to Panda and Bald Eagle.
The Cooked Owl has an admin mutation based on it.

data.mPassive: Crimson Cradle: Every 60s, decreases hatch time of egg with the highest remaining hatch time by 45s and increases its hatch speed by 20%.
data.mGeneral:
The Blood Kiwi is a mythical pet added in the Blood Moon Event update; one of the 9 pets added. It could be purchased in the Blood Moon Shop for  20,000,000 or obtained during the Summer Harvest Event. It has 45,000 hunger, and is another variation of the Kiwi pet.
The Blood Kiwi is a recolor of the Kiwi. The Kiwi is a bird with a maroon body and head, featuring an orange beak and feet, and red pupils. When singing, it produces musical notes in strong hues of red, orange, and yellow.
data.mTrivia:
The Blood Kiwi's passive is to sit above the egg with the highest remaining hatch time, reducing its hatch time by ~45s every ~60s. It also increases its hatch speed by ~20%.
However, the Kiwi remains inactive if there are no eggs on the player's plot or if all eggs have no remaining hatch.

data.mPassive: All active pets gain an additional <0.23 XP per second.
data.mGeneral:
The Night Owl dawns the appearance of its other counterpart, but with a darker purple. It is one of the 3 Owl mutations.
All active pets gain an additional >0.20 XP per second.
data.mTrivia:
Passive XP gain can be useful in attaining Pet or Egg Equip slots.
The Night Owl's ability is called "Movement Variation.

data.mObtaining_method: Mythical Egg with 8,000,000 Sheckles or 199 Roblux
data.mPassive: Scoundrel: Attempts to steal (duplicate) a seed from another user's plot every ~6 minutes if it successfully steals a seed it will try to steal another one
data.mGeneral: The Red Fox is a divine pet added in the Blood Moon Update. It has a 1.69% chance of being hatched from a Mythical Egg.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Red Fox has a blocky appearance (studs) with a bright orange-red body. It has large, triangular ears with white insides, square black eyes, and a white snout. Its legs are black, and the tip of its tail is white, matching the white fur under its neck.

Trait
Scoundrel: Every 6:50 minutes the Red Fox goes to a random player's garden and attempts to steal (duplicate) the seed to give to the owner. If succeeded, it will attempt to steal a seed again. It works only with Seed Shop plants and does not work on event/unobtainable plants.

The Red Fox, Kitsune, Kappa, and Queen Bee are the only pets to have a higher rarity than their eggs rarity.

The Red Fox is one of the few pets that can interact directly with players. The other pets are the Crab, the Kitsune and the Raccoon.
The Red Fox does not steal single-harvest plants.

data.mPassive: Apex Predator: Occasionally eats a random mutation from a fruit in your garden then roars and applies that mutation to other fruits in your garden.
data.mGeneral:
The T-Rex is a Divine pet which can be obtained from the Dinosaur Egg in the Prehistoric Event.
The T-Rex has a light-green body, with a light brown skin on its belly. It is much larger than the player and shares a unique holding animation having both arms carrying it. This animation is shared with all other pets coming from the Dinosaur Egg. (Not to be confused with the Raptor's appearance)
data.mTrivia:
Apex Predator: Every ~20m eats a random mutation from a fruit in the player's garden then roars and applies that mutation to (~3) other fruits in the player's garden. (Doesn't apply to Dawnbound)
After a mutation is eaten, it will be removed from the targeted fruit.
The T-Rex will not devour mutations from favorited fruits.
It does not devour and spread the Gold or Rainbow mutations.
Like all other pets from the Dinosaur Egg, the T-Rex cannot be put into the DNA Machine.

data.mPassive: Transmutation: Every ~5 minutes, one random crop will turn gold. (Does not work on produce with existing variants. This includes weaker variants, such as Silver)
data.mGeneral: The Dragonfly is a divine pet added in the Animal Update. It can be obtained by hatching the Bug Egg with a 1% chance.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Dragonfly is a completely golden version of a real dragonfly, but its eyes, wing tips, and tail are neon. The Dragonfly flaps its wings every client frame. It uses the same texture as the Gold mutation.

Trait
Every ~5 minutes, turns one random fruit Gold.
The Dragonfly is based off the real-life dragonfly, Anisoptera, although it more closely resembles the carboniferous creature Meganeura.
It is the first Divine pet to be released into the game.

When being held by the player, the Dragonfly is not in their hand, and rather few studs away from hand and has its head at ground. This is most likely due to the Dragonfly's true hitbox being placed at ground level and it's model being offset upwards for the hovering effect.

The Dragonfly is one of the only three pets that can apply growth-variant mutations to plants. The second one being the Butterfly and the third one being the Golden Bee.

As of now, the Dragonfly has the highest hunger count, with 100,000 hunger points.

data.mPassive:
Every ~20 Minutes, a nearby fruit becomes magically pollinated, applying the Pollinated mutation.
Every ~23 Minutes, the pet with the highest cooldown refreshes its ability! Does not refresh pet mutation abilities.
data.mGeneral: The Queen Bee is a divine pet added in the Bizzy Bee Event update. It can be obtained in the Bee Egg, which can be purchased for  30,000,000 Sheckles, 18 Honey or 129 Roblux with a 1% chance. It has 65,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Appearance
The Queen Bee is very large, towering over the player. It has a blush on her face, a crown on her head, a huge abdomen. She is identical in appearance to the NPC Queen Bee.

Trait
Queen Pollinator: Every ~20 Minutes, a nearby fruit becomes magically pollinated, applying the Pollinated mutation.
For the Queen: Every ~23 Minutes, the pet with the highest cooldown will refresh its ability! Does not refresh pet mutation abilities or French Fry Ferret's ability.

The Queen Bee can refresh another Queen Bee's ability, resulting in a potentially endless loop. It can only stop when there is another pet with a higher cooldown.

When holding the Queen Bee, the crown will occasionally sparkle with the same effect as Celestial mutation.

The Queen Bee's crown is very similar to the Coat of Arms of the New Zealand Crown, the birthplace of Jandel, one of the main developers.

This pet is one of the only pets to refresh another pet's cooldown.

data.mObtaining_method:
Anti Bee Egg
Premium Anti Bee Egg
data.mPassive: Every ~10 minutes, has a ~20% chance a nearby fruit becomes Disco!
data.mGeneral:
The Disco Bee is a Divine Pet added inside the Friendship Update.

The Disco Bee has 25,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
Obtainment
The Disco Bee can be obtained from the Anti Bee Egg with an hatch chance of 0.25%, which can be crafted or bought for 149 Roblux.

Appearance
The Disco Bee has a model of the Bee with glasses on. The Disco Bee's wings flap every client frame. Disco Bee's body coloring fluctuates through the rainbow, just like the Disco mutation.

Trait
Disco Disco: Every ~15 minutes, has a 14% + weight (in kg) chance a nearby fruit becomes Disco! (As of v1706 Ability Chance and Cooldown got Buffed/9 hours before the update/admin abuse)
Amongst all pets with ability of applying a crop mutation (Disco), The Disco Bee applies the mutation with the 2nd highest multiplier, tied with Lobster Thermidor (Meteoric) right behind HarmonisedFoxfireChackra

The Disco Bee only has 1 eye under its glasses.
Upon being hatched from an Anti Bee Egg, the Disco Bee will fly up.

data.mObtaining_method:
Oasis Egg 10 Summer Coins
Premium Oasis Egg 149 Roblux
data.mPassive: Sly: Every 22:12m, goes to another player's random fruit, copies 1 mutation from it and applies it to a random fruit the pet owner owns! The higher mutation multiplier the rarer chance to copy.
data.mGeneral: The Fennec Fox's appearance resembles that of a real-life Fennec Fox.
data.mTrivia: Every 22:12m, the Fennec Fox goes to a random fruit in a player's garden, copies one mutation from it, then applies it to any fruit in the pet owner's garden. The higher a mutation's multiplier is, the rarer it will be for the pet to succeed in copying said mutation. Cannot put mutations on favorited plants.

data.mPassive: All active pets gain >0.50 XP per second.
data.mGeneral:
The Blood Owl is a divine pet added in the Blood Moon Event update. The Blood Owl is one of the nine pets added in the update, also known as Update 1.06.0.
The Blood Owl could be obtained in the Blood Moon Shop for 60,000,000 Coins. The Blood Owl has 50,000 hunger.
data.mTrivia:
The Blood Owl shares the same model as the Owl. However, it is recolored in various shades of red. It is one of the 3 owl mutations, along with the Night Owl and Cooked Owl.
All active pets gain an additional >0.50 XP per second.

data.mPassive: Every ~15 minutes, goes to another player's plot and steals (duplicate) a random crop and gives it to the player!
data.mGeneral:
The Raccoon has a slightly complex build. It has a large face with a snout, pentagonal ears, four small legs, and a small tail. Most of its body is a plain silver. It has a "mask" over its face that is a darker gray, similar in color to its ears and the stripes on its tail. Its inner ears, paws, and tail are a darker gray that gets fairly near black. It also has a white tuft on its chest, eyebrows, and snout. Its snout has a nose, but no visible mouth and appears expressionless.
Every 15 minutes, the Raccoon goes to another player's plot and duplicates their fruit, then gives it to the pet owner.
data.mTrivia:
The Raccoon has a somewhat similar trait as the Red Fox, guaranteed to reward the player a plant, including event exclusive plants, while the Red Fox duplicates seeds from only the Seed Shop.
The Raccoon, Red Fox, and the Fennec Fox are the only pets to directly interact with other players' gardens.
The Raccoon is currently the third rarest pet in the game.
The Raccoon is one of the highest in-demand pets in the game.

data.mPassive: Friendly Frier: Every ~60:32m, increases a random pet's level by 1! Ability cannot be mimicked or refreshed.
data.mGeneral:
The appearance of the French Fry Ferret has a French Fry on his head with the "Letter G" which might mean "Gourmet" as a reference to the event and a French Fry bag on top of their head.
Friendly Frier: Every ~60:32m, increases a random pet's level by 1! Ability cannot be mimicked or refreshed.
data.mTrivia:
This section is a trivia section. Please relocate any relevant information into other sections of the article.

The Mimic Octopus cannot mimic the French Fry Ferret's ability.
Pets that decrease the cooldown of abilities such as Wasp, Tarantula Hawk, Queen Bee cannot target this pets main ability.
The French Fry Ferret has the longest minimum cooldown cap of 20:00. Most pets has 1:00 minimum cooldown cap.
